result.execSummary:
The defendant Jordan T Forseth was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Concurrent with: Waukesha County Case 09CF1408.

superMiscConds.notes:
Restitution is to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision and to be paid BEFORE costs/fines (can be taken out of prison wages/trust accounts).

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision (can be taken out of prison wages/trust accounts).
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
No contact with any of the victims listed in the criminal complaint.
DNA sample is waived.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jordan T Forseth

defendant.name: Forseth, Jordan T

records.addlTxt: Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Jordan T Forseth in court, in custody (OTP'd from DCI), with attorney J Anthony Rosario.   

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 1.
Repeater enhancer is struck.
Counts 2 & 3 are dismissed as read ins.



Court orders the following:
Total Prison: 38 Months .
Initial Confinement:  20 Months.
Extended Supervision:  18 Months.
Concurrent to: Waukesha County Case 09CF1408
  

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  Any of the victims listed in the criminal complaint.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).

RESTITUTION:  $28.75 (restitution to be paid before costs or fines);
Costs:  $268
DNA Sample (Court waives sample only) and Surcharge: $250
To be paid as a Condition of the Sentence (can be taken out of prison wages/trust accounts).

Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.



Defendant to be returned to DCI - FORTHWITH.
Detainer placed at Dodge Correctional Institution.
